text: So the last of the four opens is the open auction. Now, as the name suggests, the market
opens and it merely begins to auction between buyers and sellers. Now, firstly, let's look
at the graphic depiction. As you can see, this is an open where we kind of open, we
move up, we move down, we move up, we move down, and trade is facilitated in a relatively
narrow band between buyers and sellers. So, very little conviction in terms of where
In the example, in the volume profile provided, you can kind of see that the market opens
and it straight away, with that dark blue line, you can see it just settles into sort
of a very balanced type open play.
So, note no conviction at all with this open play.
We tend to open and trade both above and below the opening price.
We tend to see this open play particularly when we open in a very balanced manner within
the previous day's value area.
So straight away if you see the market opening within the previous day's value in the markets
that are quite symmetrical, there's a high probability you're going to get this open
an hour or a couple of hours of trade.
Note the question to ask is, where does this open occur?
More often than not you will see this open in a balanced type open.
However sometimes we can see this when we open completely out of balance and the reason
for this is that when we open out of balance we get a lot of people being dragged in
or a lot of other time frame participants being dragged in at these much higher or
much lower prices resulting in a lot of two way auctioning between buyers and sellers.
So note again when we're in balance, it's likely to stay that way for some period of time with minimal convictions
So straight away you got to say to yourself bang if the market opens and we're opening well within balance
And we see quite a lot of two-way trade
You know we can take on strategies looking to extend above and below the opening price
Equally, if we open out of balance, we can see the same sort of open just with a little
bit more volatility and again trading both above and below the opening price.
That is pretty much our open auction, and note it's important when thinking and talking
about the open auction type trade, we want to be talking about it in terms of is it
in balance or out of balance, as this will determine how we take on the trade and the
approach we use to take on the open auction trade.
